arch:note.arch:string: The purpose of the daily journal was to record the activities taking place in a trench each day. This included which loci were excavated, how and why loci were excavated and the ongoing impressions of the relationships among loci. It should be noted that journals record the actions, impressions and ideas of trench supervisors during the excavations. They are not, therefore, the final interpretations or syntheses of the emerging data.

arch:internalDocument.arch:string:
Daily Journal

July 19, 2004

Area D

Trench 8

E. O.

Today is a day that we need to move lots of dirt and make decisions about what it is that we have in this trench. To facilitate this we first decided what it was we were unsure about and then we planned how to answer those questions. The first questionable are was L19. L19 at first appeared to be a wall that was not well defined that was up against wall L14. However the more we excavated the more this pet theory was disproved. We had brought down the area to the west of L19 but this had not really helped. So finally, though much debate and consultation with all the excavators and both of the directors, we decided to cut a section through the width of L19. We cut it through where we had thought that we had seen a brick and took it all the way through the first row of bricks in L14. The first cut of this sounding revealed a brick in the very west end of the sounding up against the edge the locus. This brick would have hit floor L9. We took the rest of the sounding down five more centimeters leaving this brick in place. When the sounding was done and we looked at it became apparent that this locus was just fill except for a possible wall on the west edge. We did not find a continuation of the floor L9 and the presence of the brick material proved that the floor had stopped where we originally thought because it hit this row of bricks. The second question we had was about the mixed material in L24. It appeared to be a pit, a very large one, so we excavated it as such. As we excavated it began to look like it was not a pit but a fill layer. The unexpected benefit of excavating this area as a pit was that it gave a good side view of the wall L 23. We had been unsure if L23 actually were a wall because there were no brick lines. However this may be due to the way it was constructed. Perhaps the bricks were not dried out long enough so they did not retain their individual shape. L32 is the plaster floor which was what the fill locus L24 was resting on. We were not able to find this floor in the area above L30 which was another reason we thought it might have been a pit that was cut through the floor. However we did not see the floor in the balk either. Possibly the floor was simply too damaged to show up in this area. It looks like this same fill continues under the floor which is L32.

With L30 taken care of we went back to L19. Now tat we knew what it was we took it down 10 cm. We also took out the floor L29 and took that area down too. L19 and L28 the sub floor ended up at about the same level straddling the pedestaled wall L34. once we had it pedestaled it looked like there was only brick half was down the pedestaled section, the rest did not look like brick or feel hard enough to be wall. As we were sweeping L19 and L28 we saw the lines of two more walls. These new walls are underneath the walls that we have showing, including 34, 14, and 23. We immediately stopped so that we could clean and photo. Because it was so close to the end of they day I decided to wait and start the new loci tomorrow when I have time to take measurements and other record keeping issues. While I was examining the new walls the guys had been taking down the area to the south of L14, which is the bottom of L5, five centimeters. I had thought that there was another cobble surface in some of that area (L25) however this did not show up and the guys took down part of what had previously been assigned as L25 in the new locus L33 without seeing it. We are doing this in order to continue defining L14 so that it is ready for an overhead plan photo.

We also excavated the ash pit in the southwest corner, L20 and are hoping to continue working on that area, including Loci, 21, 17, and 22 tomorrow.

As it stands now it looks like walls 14 and 17 are contemporaneous. If 34 is part of a wall then it should go with this too.

Wall 23 is different than the other three

There are two new different walls under the area of walls 14 and 34.
